command.intro: Corrects errors in fastq files based on k-mer abundance

command.intro: Performs single individual molecular haplotyping
command.title: Molecular haplotyping of single individuals
command.description: Performs molecular haplotyping on a single individual given a VCF and a set of alignments in BAM format. Although theoretically it can work with Illumina reads, it is designed to work fine with long (PacBio) reads. Writes to standard output the phased VCF
command.option: Algorithm for single individual haplotypiing. It can be Refhap or DGS

command.intro: Generates a VCF file including the whole set of variants called in at least one of the given samples.
command.title: Merging variants from individual samples
command.description: First step merging variants from different samples into an integrated VCF file. Generates a file including the whole set of variants called in at least one sample. The sequence names file is a text file with the ids of the sequences in the reference.

command.intro: Writes a final VCF file with the genotype calls for each variant on each sample.
command.title: Merging variants from individual samples
command.description: Last step to merge genotype calls from different samples into an integrated VCF file. Generates a file including the whole set of variants called for all samples. The sequence names file is a text file with the ids of the sequences in the reference. Writes to the standard output.

command.intro: Generates a VCF file which includes the functional information related with each variant.
command.title: Functional annotation of variants
command.description: Generates a VCF file including the functional information related with each variant. Requires a VCF file, a gff3 file with gene annotations, and the reference genome in fasta format.

Maximum bp after a gene to classify a variant as Downstream.

command.intro: Implements different filters on VCF files with genotype information

Finally, it recalculates the number of samples genotyped, the number of alleles called and the MAF to execute the remaining filters. Writes to the standard output.

command.intro: Detects sequencing error biases
command.title: Calculating base quality statistics
command.description: This module takes one or more sets of alignments and a reference genome and counts the number of mismatches with the reference for each read position from 5' to 3' end. This report is useful to detect sequencing error biases. Requires alignment files to be in SAM|BAM format, and the reference genome that was used to produce the alignments.
command.option: Deprecated. Use minMQ option to control which alignments are considered unique
Minimum mapping quality to call an alignment unique

command.intro: Shows the uniformity of the sequencing process over the genome
command.title: Calculating coverage statistics
command.description: This module calculates the number of base pairs that are covered by reads at each coverage level from 1 to a maximum. Alignments must be in SAM|BAM format.
command.option: Minimum mapping quality to call an alignment unique

command.intro: Compares the genotype calls included in two different VCF files
command.title: Comparing VCF files
command.description: Compare the genotype calls included in two different VCF files. Calculate the number and percentage of homozygous and heterozygous differences between every pair of samples. The first required argument is the FASTA file with the reference genome used to generate the VCF files Writes to the standard output.
command.option: Minimum percentage (0-100) of variants genotyped in both samples
Maximum percentage (0-100) of differences between the pair of samples

command.intro: Generates a report with the numbers of variants included in a VCF file for different categories.
command.title: Calculating summary statistics
command.description: Generate a report with the variants included in a VCF file for different categories. It is specially useful when a complete population is being processed and merged into a single annotated file. Writes to the standard output
command.option: Minimum number of samples genotyped to accurately calculate the minor allele frequency

command.intro: Calculates basic diversity statistics for each variant in a VCF file.
command.title: Calculating diversity statistics per site
command.description: Calculate basic diversity statistics for each variant in a VCF file. The populations file is a tab-delimited text file with two columns: sample id and population id. Writes to the standard output. See the README.txt file for details on the output.

command.intro: Calculates a genetic distance matrix from genomic variants in a given VCF file
command.title: Calculation of genetic distance matrices from VCF files
command.description: Generates a distance matrix from a variants file in VCF format. The matrix is calculated using the basic IBS (Identity by state) algorithm. However, four options to infer the genotype call information are implemented. In particular, users can choose predicted allele dosages of CNVs or direct estimations of allele dosage per site per individual based on relative allele-specific read counts. The latter option is useful to improve distance estimations in polyploids. It writes to standard output the matrix of genetic distances in a generic format.
command.option: Matrix output format, 0 is full matrix, 1 lower-left matrix and 2 is upper right matrix.

Source of information in the VCF file to calculate distances. 0 for simple genotype calls (GT format field), 1 for allele copy number (ACN format field), 2 for total copy number (total of ACN format field), and 3 for raw allele depth (DP format field)
Default ploidy of the samples. Used if the distance source (-s option) is the raw allele depths to recalculate allele dosage based on these counts

command.intro: Construct a neighbor joining dendogram given a distance matrix file
command.title: Building dendograms using the Neighbor-Joining algorithm
command.description: Given a distance matrix file, this command builds a dendogram for graphical display of genetic distances using the Neighbor Joining algorithm. The distance matrix can be provided as an upper, lower or full matrix. The dendogram is written to standard output in Newick format.

command.intro: Calculates allele sharing diversity statistics, either through windows or through genes for inbred populations
command.title: Calculating allele sharing statistics
command.description: Calculates allele sharing diversity statistics, either through windows across the genome or through the genes catalog of the species. This program calculates the pairwise differences between every pair of samples in the VCF file and uses that information to calculate diversity statistics such as the average number of pairwise differences per Kbp, Fst and Tajima D. This functionality should only be applied to VCFs containing populations of inbred samples. Each group can either be one or more than populations wthin the populations file. Multiple population names within one group should be separated by comma (without white spaces). The populations file is a tab-delimited text file with two columns: sample id and population id. Writes to the standard output. See the README.txt file for details on the output.
command.option: GFF3 file with the transcriptome. If this file is provided, statistics will be provided by gene and not by window.
If set, introns will be included in the calculation of pairwise differences. Only useful if the -t option is set
Length of each genomic window to calculate pairwise differences between samples.
Step between windows to calculate pairwise differences between samples.

command.intro: Imputes missing genotypes from unphased multilocus SNP genotype data in a VCF.
command.title: Genotype imputation
command.description: Impute missing genotypes from unphased multilocus SNP genotype data in a VCF. * Only biallelic SNPs are imputed and included in the output VCF file.
command.option: Comma-separated list of sample ids of the parents of the population. Only to be used for bi-parental or multi-parental breeding populations.

Maximum number of groups in which local haplotypes will be clustered. For bi-parental or multi-parental breeding populations please set explicitly the number of parents of the population even if the list of parents is provided with the -p option. This allows to take into account cases of populations in which some of the parents are missing
Size of the window to process variants at the same time
Overlap between windows
Estimated average number of centiMorgans per Kbp on euchromatic regions of the genome. Typical values of this parameter are 0.001 for human populations, 0.004 for rice and 0.35 for yeast populations

If set, transition probabilities in the HMM will NOT be updated during the Baum-Welch training of the HMM. Not recommended unless the -c option is set to a value allowing a reasonable initial estimation of the transition probabilities.
Specifies that parents of the population are inbreds
Specifies that the samples to impute are inbreds

command.intro: Runs a window-based haplotype introgression analysis.
command.title: Finding haplotype introgressions
command.description: Runs a window-based analysis to identify the most common haplotype within each of the populations described in the given populations file and then identify common haplotypes of one population introgressed in samples of a different population. Although it can be run on any VCF file, it is particularly designed to work with populations of inbred samples.
command.option: Minimum percentage of samples genotyped within a population to identify the most common allele.
Minimum difference between reference allele frequencies of at least two populations to consider a variant discriminative.
Maximum minor allele frequency within a population to consider the major allele of a variant as representative allele for such population.
Window size as number of variants within each window
Overlap as number of variants shared between neighbor windows
Score given of a match between homozygous genotypes comparing haplotypes
Score given of a mismatch between homozygous genotypes comparing haplotypes
Minimum score to match an individual haplotype with a population-derived haplotype
Outputs a VCF file with the biallelic variants that showed segregation between at least one pair of groups and hence were selected for the analysis.
If set, reports introgression events for unassigned haplotypes according to the minimum score defined by the options -a -i and -s

command.intro: Builds individual fastq files for different samples from a single file containing reads from a whole sequencing lane (Former Deconvolute)
command.title: Demultiplexing reads
command.description: Build individual fastq files for different samples from a single file containing the reads for a whole sequencing lane in which several samples were barcoded and sequenced. INDEX_FILE is a tab-delimited file with four columns by default: flowcell, lane, barcode and sampleID. If the -a option for dual barcode is activated, five columns are expected: flowcell, lane, barcode1, barcode2 and sampleID. The file must have a header line. The same index file can be used to demultiplex several FASTQ files. Out FASTQ files will be gzip compressed by default
command.option: Directory where the output fastq files will be saved.
If this sequence is found within a read, the read will be trimmed up to the start of this sequence.
Output uncompressed files.
Minimum read length to keep a read after trimming adapter sequences
Activate demultiplexing with dual barcoding.

Tab-delimited file listing the lane FASTQ files to be demultiplexed. Columns are: Flowcell, lane and fastq file (which can be gzip compressed). A second fastq file can be specified for pair-end sequencing. If the reads sequenced for one lane are split in multiple files, each file (or each pair of files) should be included in a separate row. If this option is used, the options -f, -l and the input fastq file(s) are ignored
Id of the flowcell corresponding to the input fastq file(s). Required if -d option is not specified.
Id of the lane corresponding to the input fastq file(s). Required if the -d option is not specified.
